Event.name: Punctual_perception
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Perceiver</fen> briefly perceives a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>, often resulting in partial or uncertain perception. A <fen>Body_part</fen> that enables the perception may be mentioned, either metonymically replacing the <fen>Perceiver</fen> or in addition to the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Perceiver">I</fex> 've been waiting here to <m>catch</m> a <t>glimpse</t> <fex name="Phenomenon">of the snow leopard</fex> for seven hours.</ex> <ex>If you go in there, <fex name="Perceiver">you</fex> 'll <t>get</t> an <t>eyeful</t>. <fex name="Phenomenon">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Perceiver
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The being who has a perceptual experience, generally construed to be not on purpose.
<ex>When she looked back, <fex name="Perceiver">Maria</fex> <t>glimpsed</t> an arm clawing around the corner.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Phenomenon
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The entity or phenomenon that the perceiver experiences with his or her senses. It is typically expressed as Object with verbs.
<ex>The waiter <t>glimpsed</t> <fex name="Phenomenon">a fly</fex> disappearing under the surface of the soup.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Body_part
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the location on the body where the perceptual experience takes place. It is typically expressed in a PP.
<ex>Mata Hari turned to her lawyer as <fex name="BodP">her eyes</fex> <t>glimpsed</t> the blindfold.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Location_of_protagonist</fen> during the perceptual experience. It is typically expressed in a <ment>from</ment>-PP.
<ex>She had only <t>glimpsed</t> him briefly <fex name="Location_of_protagonist">from behind a veil</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver (see above), that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception.
<ex>Hard to be certain what I <t>glimpsed</t> <fex name="Direction">through the crack of the door</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Perceiver</fen> during the event of perception.</def-root>

Arg.name: Ground
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The perceptual background against which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is experienced (or not experienced) by the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
<ex>Had he caught a <t>glimpse</t> of her face <fex name="Ground">among the crowd</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of properties of perception, such as: <ment>clearly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>, etc.
<ex>Pat <fex name="Manner">secretly</fex> <t>glimpsed</t> the designs for a new headquarters.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> indicates the degree to which the Perception is experienced.
<ex>A nightmare creature, <fex name="Degr">barely</fex> <t>glimpsed</t> in the swirling dense smoke, was beating at the flames coming from its own body.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action whereby the <fen>Perceiver</fen> perceives.
<ex>He just <t>glimpsed</t> the car <fex name="Mns">by craning his neck</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen>, generally construed as punctual, at which the <fen>Perceiver</fen> or the <fen>Body_part</fen> perceives the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: glimpse.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the event or fact of briefly seeing.

lexUnit.name: get an eyeful.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to briefly see (a sufficient quantity of s.t. prurient)
